channel.title: [RESOLVED - ACCEPTED] Removal of 20,000 character limit in some cases
channel.description:
Well for basically ANY tutorial that I post, they all have too much code to be posted with code tags. So I end up always needing to use pastebin. It's not a real problem, I just don't see a reason to have the limit, in the tutorial section at least.
Examples: https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,671332.0.html https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,653856.msg4380153.html#msg4380153 https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,490285.0.html
And those are just the ones I remember needing to use pastebin for.
I wouldn't be opposed to completely removing it, because I honestly don't see the point. But if we can just remove it for sections which require a pretty big amount of text EG(Server tutorials, Server development, Server Help, Private server client hacking) it would be convenient.

item.title: [RESOLVED - ACCEPTED] Removal of 20,000 character limit in some cases
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

The character limit has been extended to 50,000. We can deal with any annoying cases of abuse as they occur, not like such cases weren’t already possible before hand though. I came to 50,000 given the cases of reaching the limit I’ve been messaged about that I could find, it seems to accommodate everyone. I get the arguments for having it higher, but let’s not be pedantic, it’s fine. If you need more than 50,000 characters in one individual topic then I don’t see the issue with sectioning it off into multiple linked topics, or we can work something out for you.

Solved.

Read full topic
item.source: [RESOLVED - ACCEPTED] Removal of 20,000 character limit in some cases

item.title: [RESOLVED - ACCEPTED] Removal of 20,000 character limit in some cases
item.dc:creator: @EcoPS_GM EcoPS GM
item.description:
@EcoPS_GM wrote:

Taharok:

The path of least resistance here is just having an admin up the char limit. I see nothing wrong with that. The problem is, I don’t really see anyone actually caring about this suggestion because no one has answered my question yet.

I answered it before you even asked.

Read full topic
item.source: [RESOLVED - ACCEPTED] Removal of 20,000 character limit in some cases

item.title: [RESOLVED - ACCEPTED] Removal of 20,000 character limit in some cases
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“Jmood, post:44, topic:552427”][quote author=asshole_rule link=topic=671346.msg4493060#msg4493060 date=1439409692]

Potential fix:

  • Make all BB code tags not count towards the limit (iirc they do)

there’s nothing stopping anyone from just surrounding whatever they want with bb code and having no limits at all.

Taharok, 20k is a fine limit. It has been around for a long time and until recently no one has ever cared enough to need it changed.

talk out of your ass some more. It’s been a problem for me, and others for a while now. There’s no point in changing something that really would have no negative effects. Seems like people just will look for whatever reason they can to prevent change, on this forum anyway.

The path of least resistance here is just having an admin up the char limit. I see nothing wrong with that. The problem is, I don’t really see anyone actually caring about this suggestion because no one has answered my question yet.

I didn’t realize this topic picked up steam again. I kind of just let the idea die because none of the admins seemed to care. I really just want a substantial increase, or alternative to 20k limit. I’ll let the admins decide what’s best. There’s some okay ideas being thrown out

[/quote]

Please grow up. I am not looking to prevent changes on the forum, I am looking to prevent worthless changes. Please don’t take a single line out of my entire post and spew your hate because a change hasn’t been made in your favor. Through out the entire topic you haven’t suggested any new idea or even a compromise to upping the limit, in fact all you have said this entire time is “why not just increase the limit???”. You cannot even contribute any real reason other than “I want to post my entire class so I don’t have to use pastebin”. Just shows that you have put little to no thought in your suggestion at all. As for all the links you posted as reasons why it should be increase, all of them are full sized classes that should be in the pastebin anyways. So again why increase the limit when pastebin can be used for large amounts of code that is only going to be copied and pasted into a file?

http://pastebin.com/mCN10TS8
http://pastebin.com/bXdEuBeU
http://pastebin.com/UWx1uNZH

As I said before I am not against the idea of raising the limit. I am against the idea of just raising it to make certain members happier because they cannot post full sized classes. I am for increasing the limit for certain areas of the forum that need it (“Tutorials, Advertisements, and Development.”). Even then you should still use pastebin for large amounts of code that need to be copied and pasted into a file.[/quote]

If the change is worthless please state how? I’m not hating on you at all, just wanted to point out that ignorant statement you made. You really did make that statement based on just about nothing. “No one has ever cared enough…” well obviously that’s wrong because I clearly made a thread about it and it has supporters behind it. I have in fact suggested compromises such as removing the limit in general for the tutorial section, dev section, help section, among others (which i don’t believe is a good idea now that i’ve thought about it).

Jmood:

You cannot even contribute any real reason other than “I want to post my entire class so I don’t have to use pastebin”.

As I stated in the OP: (Server tutorials, Server development, Server Help, Private server client hacking) are all sections that would benefit from this. I’m sorry if you’re slightly illiterate and could only read the part where I want to be able to post a whole class, which by the way isn’t as ridiculous of a request as you might think.

It’s personal preference whether or not to post code in code tags or on pastebin. There is no rule that I know of that states I have to choose pastebin over code tags.

You are literally the only person who is against this. All I suggested is we do something about it, and we should be able to come together as a forum to think of a better way to do this. It’s not my sole job as the OP to figure out a solution. So, if it’s such a useless change, please state why because I don’t see any reasoning behind your opinion.

You are the one who needs to grow up, child.

Read full topic
item.source: [RESOLVED - ACCEPTED] Removal of 20,000 character limit in some cases

Potential fix:

  • Make all BB code tags not count towards the limit (iirc they do)
    [/quote]

there’s nothing stopping anyone from just surrounding whatever they want with bb code and having no limits at all.

Taharok, 20k is a fine limit. It has been around for a long time and until recently no one has ever cared enough to need it changed.

talk out of your ass some more. It’s been a problem for me, and others for a while now. There’s no point in changing something that really would have no negative effects. Seems like people just will look for whatever reason they can to prevent change, on this forum anyway.

The path of least resistance here is just having an admin up the char limit. I see nothing wrong with that. The problem is, I don’t really see anyone actually caring about this suggestion because no one has answered my question yet.

I didn’t realize this topic picked up steam again. I kind of just let the idea die because none of the admins seemed to care. I really just want a substantial increase, or alternative to 20k limit. I’ll let the admins decide what’s best. There’s some okay ideas being thrown out[/quote]

Please grow up. I am not looking to prevent changes on the forum, I am looking to prevent worthless changes. Please don’t take a single line out of my entire post and spew your hate because a change hasn’t been made in your favor. Through out the entire topic you haven’t suggested any new idea or even a compromise to upping the limit, in fact all you have said this entire time is “why not just increase the limit???”. You cannot even contribute any real reason other than “I want to post my entire class so I don’t have to use pastebin”. Just shows that you have put little to no thought in your suggestion at all. As for all the links you posted as reasons why it should be increase, all of them are full sized classes that should be in the pastebin anyways. So again why increase the limit when pastebin can be used for large amounts of code that is only going to be copied and pasted into a file?

http://pastebin.com/mCN10TS8
http://pastebin.com/bXdEuBeU
http://pastebin.com/UWx1uNZH

As I said before I am not against the idea of raising the limit. I am against the idea of just raising it to make certain members happier because they cannot post full sized classes. I am for increasing the limit for certain areas of the forum that need it (“Tutorials, Advertisements, and Development.”). Even then you should still use pastebin for large amounts of code that need to be copied and pasted into a file.

Read full topic

item.source: [RESOLVED - ACCEPTED] Removal of 20,000 character limit in some cases

item.title: [RESOLVED - ACCEPTED] Removal of 20,000 character limit in some cases
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Jmood, post:40, topic:552427”][quote author=Zymus link=topic=671346.msg4493008#msg4493008 date=1439364476]

I path of least resistance here is just having an admin up the char limit. I see nothing wrong with that. The problem is, I don’t really see anyone actually caring about this suggestion because no one has answered my question yet.

I care about it slightly as I deal with people that post long strings of code.
However, I can’t think of a suitable number.
A delta’s Client.java can have 1 million characters however, I don’t think we should make the limit 1 million characters…

I’d say in the region of 40-45k.

What happens when users want it increased again? Do we bump it again? I’m all for getting a specific number, but my question is, at what point do we start to seriously consider alternatives? Honestly, I don’t see very many user complaints about this; usually when I see something in server help, the user posts it on pastebin anyways. If the primary use case for this is for the Tutorials Section, then perhaps we could lift the limit in those places. But then another question I have is, perhaps tutorials as a whole can be done differently.
[/quote]

Taharok, 20k is a fine limit. It has been around for a long time and until recently no one has ever cared enough to need it changed.

As suggested why not raise it in tutorials, the development sections, and the advertising section. Those are the only areas I can see it needing to be raise to say 35k.

As for in the help sections, as said before and in the above post. Pastebin should be used for full classes. No point what so ever for a person to need to post the entire class in the topic.

EDIT: As for the double posting, just do what we have done in the past. Get someone you trust or even a mod to post the moment you create your thread, post again, other posts, you post, other posts. After which the other person deletes their posts and you now have 4-7 reserve posts for use.[/quote]

People have been complaining about the 20k limit for the last 8 years. As far as I’m concerned, there’s no harm in raising the limit to accommodate people now. Modifying the code of the forum is the hardest way to make a change to anything here, which is why it’s unlikely. The only change that I think is worthwhile aside from just upping the limit is to allow double posting if it’s immediately after the main post and the last post is above some certain threshold of size. This is likely easy to program and achieves the exact effect people want: to be able to post as large of topics as they want initially. Replies are very rarely over 20k.

Read full topic
item.source: [RESOLVED - ACCEPTED] Removal of 20,000 character limit in some cases

item.title: [RESOLVED - ACCEPTED] Removal of 20,000 character limit in some cases
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“Zymus, post:39, topic:552427”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=671346.msg4492999#msg4492999 date=1439354388]

I path of least resistance here is just having an admin up the char limit. I see nothing wrong with that. The problem is, I don’t really see anyone actually caring about this suggestion because no one has answered my question yet.

I care about it slightly as I deal with people that post long strings of code.
However, I can’t think of a suitable number.
A delta’s Client.java can have 1 million characters however, I don’t think we should make the limit 1 million characters…

I’d say in the region of 40-45k.
[/quote]

What happens when users want it increased again? Do we bump it again? I’m all for getting a specific number, but my question is, at what point do we start to seriously consider alternatives? Honestly, I don’t see very many user complaints about this; usually when I see something in server help, the user posts it on pastebin anyways. If the primary use case for this is for the Tutorials Section, then perhaps we could lift the limit in those places. But then another question I have is, perhaps tutorials as a whole can be done differently.[/quote]

Taharok, 20k is a fine limit. It has been around for a long time and until recently no one has ever cared enough to need it changed.

As suggested why not raise it in tutorials, the development sections, and the advertising section. Those are the only areas I can see it needing to be raise to say 35k.

As for in the help sections, as said before and in the above post. Pastebin should be used for full classes. No point what so ever for a person to need to post the entire class in the topic.

EDIT: As for the double posting, just do what we have done in the past. Get someone you trust or even a mod to post the moment you create your thread, post again, other posts, you post, other posts. After which the other person deletes their posts and you now have 4-7 reserve posts for use.

Read full topic

item.title: [RESOLVED - ACCEPTED] Removal of 20,000 character limit in some cases
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:34, topic:552427”][quote author=Bowser jr link=topic=671346.msg4492901#msg4492901 date=1439310485]

Maybe we’re looking at it the wrong way. Maybe what we need is an SMF pastebin plugin. Post the code to pastebin, then just have like a [pastebin id=abcdef123456] tag. On page load, fetch it from the site

Because what we need is to add more custom code to the forum.
[/quote]
It doesn’t need to be handled on the server. You can offer a Greasemonkey script for users to install if they don’t like opening each link in a new tab (see my prototype above), or that code can be moved into the view too. Gist already has a great looking embed, and is versioned, I don’t see why we aren’t moving towards that anyways.

The goal is to keep the load off the MSCP servers, so we need to keep it client sided as much as possible.[/quote]

I would disagree. I think we need to keep it as user friendly as possible. Requiring users to not only install a browser plugin, but also download a custom script not only makes it a pain for the user, but then you have to deal with things like browser compatibility, and how will silab criticize everything we do from behind the great firewall of China?

Read full topic
item.source: [RESOLVED - ACCEPTED] Removal of 20,000 character limit in some cases

item.title: [RESOLVED - ACCEPTED] Removal of 20,000 character limit in some cases
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:28, topic:552427”][quote author=Zymus link=topic=671346.msg4492821#msg4492821 date=1439256363]
Maybe we’re looking at it the wrong way. Maybe what we need is an SMF pastebin plugin. Post the code to pastebin, then just have like a [pastebin id=abcdef123456] tag. On page load, fetch it from the site
[/quote]
Because what we need is to add more custom code to the forum.[/quote]
It doesn’t need to be handled on the server. You can offer a Greasemonkey script for users to install if they don’t like opening each link in a new tab (see my prototype above), or that code can be moved into the view too. Gist already has a great looking embed, and is versioned, I don’t see why we aren’t moving towards that anyways.

The goal is to keep the load off the MSCP servers, so we need to keep it client sided as much as possible.

Read full topic

item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

Potential fix:

  • Make all BB code tags not count towards the limit (iirc they do)
  • A plugin that embeds common pastes (paste.ee, pastie.org, pastebin.com, gist.github.com, etc) into the post view without actually adding it to the post

item.source: [RESOLVED - ACCEPTED] Removal of 20,000 character limit in some cases

item.title: [RESOLVED - ACCEPTED] Removal of 20,000 character limit in some cases
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Zymus, post:30, topic:552427”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=671346.msg4492914#msg4492914 date=1439315158]
And we’ve hit that point that we get to in every community suggestion…
Now we’re going to sit here and discuss adding new extensions and etc even though the suggestion was to just change a number from 20,000 to (As an example) 40,000.

[/quote]

The only reason I suggested making a plugin, or using an existing one was to address some concerns that were brought up. If there’s a worry about storage space, then off loading the bulk of the data to another server, whose sole intention is for storing text data, could be an alternative. It wouldn’t be a client-side plugin because anyone who doesn’t have it wouldn’t be able to view the content.[/quote]
I understand, but I’m just saying it seems that all the solutions to anything suggested is “add an extension” or "write a tool"
And then one of the following happens:
It’s already created, but never implemented
No one wants to write it, or the ones that do don’t have the talent
Nothing happens.

Read full topic
item.source: [RESOLVED - ACCEPTED] Removal of 20,000 character limit in some cases

item.title: [RESOLVED - ACCEPTED] Removal of 20,000 character limit in some cases
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:29, topic:552427”]And we’ve hit that point that we get to in every community suggestion…
Now we’re going to sit here and discuss adding new extensions and etc even though the suggestion was to just change a number from 20,000 to (As an example) 40,000.[/quote]

The only reason I suggested making a plugin, or using an existing one was to address some concerns that were brought up. If there’s a worry about storage space, then off loading the bulk of the data to another server, whose sole intention is for storing text data, could be an alternative. It wouldn’t be a client-side plugin because anyone who doesn’t have it wouldn’t be able to view the content.

Read full topic
